title: Remove Pages from a PDF File for Free: 6 Ways

steps.title: Open the PDF file.
steps.content: Open the PDF file. By default, it should open in your preferred browser. On both Windows 10 and 11, you can use the built-in Microsoft Print to PDF feature to keep only specific pages, therefore "deleting" unwanted pages.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+P.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + P . This will open the Print menu.

steps.title: Click the "Destination" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the "Destination" drop-down menu. You'll see a list of available printers and other destinations.

steps.title: Click Microsoft Print to PDF.
steps.content: Click Microsoft Print to PDF . This will be listed in the drop-down menu. If you don't see this option, do the following to enable it: Open the Start menu. Type "turn windows features on or off". Click the first option. Check the box next to Microsoft Print to PDF . Click OK .

steps.title: Set "Pages" as Custom.
steps.content: Set "Pages" as Custom . Click the drop-down menu to see more options. By default, this will be preset to All .

steps.title: Specify the pages you want to save.
steps.content: Specify the pages you want to save. You only need to include the pages you want to keep; don't include the pages you want to delete. For example, to keep all pages except 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 13 from a 20-page document, enter the following: 1-3, 5, 10-12, 14-20

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This is the button at the bottom of the screen. A new window will open.

steps.title: Select a save location and click Save.
steps.content: Select a save location and click Save . The new PDF will be saved to your computer, without the unwanted pages.

steps.title: Open the PDF file.
steps.content: Open the PDF file. By default, it should open in the Preview app. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+P.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + P . This will open the Print menu.

steps.title: Set "Pages" as Selected Pages in Sidebar.
steps.content: Set "Pages" as Selected Pages in Sidebar . By default, this will be preset to All .

steps.title: Select the pages you want to keep.
steps.content: Select the pages you want to keep. Click the thumbnails in the sidebar to select them. Deselect the pages to "delete" them from the new document.

steps.title: Click the down arrow next to "PDF".
steps.content: Click the down arrow next to "PDF". This is towards the bottom of the menu. You'll see a list of options.

steps.title: Select Save as PDF.
steps.content: Select Save as PDF . This will be listed in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This is the button at the bottom of the screen. A new window will open.

steps.title: Select a save location and click Save.
steps.content: Select a save location and click Save . The new PDF file will be saved, without the unwanted pages. You can also enter information such as the Title, Subject, and Keywords to make the file easier to find later.

steps.title: Open the PDF file in Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open the PDF file in Google Chrome. If Google Chrome isn't your default PDF viewer, right-click (or Command-click) the file, click Open with , and then select Google Chrome .

steps.title: Click the Print icon.
steps.content: Click the Print icon. This is in the top-right corner of the page. A printing menu will open.

steps.title: Set "Destination" as Save as PDF.
steps.content: Set "Destination" as Save as PDF . Click the drop-down menu to see more options. If you have other printers connected, you'll also see them here.

steps.title: Set "Pages" as Custom.
steps.content: Set "Pages" as Custom . Click the drop-down menu to see more options. By default, this will be preset to All .

steps.title: Specify the pages you want to save.
steps.content: Specify the pages you want to save. You only need to include the pages you want to keep; don't include the pages you want to delete. For example, to keep all pages except 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 13 from a 20-page document, enter the following: 1-3, 5, 10-12, 14-20

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This is the blue button at the bottom. A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Select a save location and click Save.
steps.content: Select a save location and click Save . For some devices, the default location may be set to the Downloads folder. The new PDF will be saved to your computer without the undesired pages.

steps.title: Go to https://www.adobe.com/acrobat/online/delete-pdf-pages.html in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.adobe.com/acrobat/online/delete-pdf-pages.html in a web browser. This opens Adobe's online tool to delete pages from a PDF. You can use the online tool for free with an Adobe account.

steps.title: Click Select a file or drag and drop a PDF to the browser.
steps.content: Click Select a file or drag and drop a PDF to the browser. If you are using your file manager (File Explorer on Windows and Finder on Mac), double-click to open a file in the Adobe tool.

steps.title: Sign into your Adobe account.
steps.content: Sign into your Adobe account. If you don't have a free account, you can create one by clicking Create a free account .

steps.title: Delete pages.
steps.content: Delete pages. You can hover your mouse over a page to prompt icons to appear. Click the trashcan icon to delete a single page. Click the box in the top left corner of the pages to select them, then tap the trashcan icon in the menubar to delete multiple pages at once.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the top right corner of your browser and will direct you to a preview of the PDF without the deleted pages.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . It's in the top menu bar towards the right side of the page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://smallpdf.com/delete-pages-from-pdf in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://smallpdf.com/delete-pages-from-pdf in a web browser. This opens SmallPDF's Delete Pages from PDF tool. SmallPDF is a free online tool you can use to quickly remove pages from a PDF. You can use SmallPDF to delete pages from 2 PDFs each day for free. If you want unlimited edits, you can get a 7-day free trial , which also allows you to make other changes to PDFs in your web browser. With all third-party websites, avoid uploading files with sensitive information.

steps.title: Click CHOOSE FILES.
steps.content: Click CHOOSE FILES . It's at the middle of the page. You can also drag-and-drop the PDF into the purple box and skip the next step.

steps.title: Select your PDF and click Open.
steps.content: Select your PDF and click Open . This uploads your file to SmallPDF and displays the pages as thumbnails (small images).

steps.title: Click the trash icon on the page.
steps.content: Click the trash icon on the page. It's a large icon in the middle of the page and also in the thumbnail. This removes that page from the file. [3] X Research source Repeat this step for all other pages you want to delete.

steps.title: Click Finish.
steps.content: Click Finish . It's the blue button near the top of your browser. This removes the selected pages and displays a preview.

steps.title: Click Download to save the file.
steps.content: Click Download to save the file. This saves the new version of the PDF to your computer.

steps.title: Open the PDF in Adobe Acrobat.
steps.content: Open the PDF in Adobe Acrobat . This is a paid program that allows you to extract pages from a PDF. [4] X Research source . This feature is not available in the free version of Adobe Acrobat (Reader). If the PDF doesn't open in Acrobat, right-click the file, choose Open with , and then select Acrobat .

steps.title: Click Organize Pages.
steps.content: Click Organize Pages . It's in the right panel (in the secondary toolbar). You'll now see thumbnails (small versions of each page) in the Document area.

steps.title: Select the page you want to delete.
steps.content: Select the page you want to delete . Click the thumbnails in the Document area. If you want to select multiple pages at once, click the Page Thumbnails button in the left panel to display thumbnails in a panel called "Page Thumbnails." Then, press and hold Ctrl (PC) or Command (Mac) as you click each page you want to delete in that panel.

steps.title: Click the trash icon to delete the selected page(s).
steps.content: Click the trash icon to delete the selected page(s). If you just selected one page, click the trash icon right next to it. If you selected multiple pages, click the trash icon at the top of the Page Thumbnails panel. [5] X Research source
